Case 3: Heavy damping

If \(k^2-4mn>0\), i.e. \(k^2>4mn\), then there are two real roots of the auxiliary equation, \(\lambda_1\) and \(\lambda_2:\)

\(\qquad \lambda_1= \dfrac{-k+\sqrt{k^2-4mn}}{2m} \qquad \lambda_2 = \dfrac{-k-\sqrt{k^2-4mn}}{2m}\)

Then

\(\qquad x = A\text{e}^{\lambda_1t}+B\text{e}^{\lambda_2t}.\)
